result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Sell Dang. Weapon to Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May move with grandmother to Northern Wisconsin - Probation may be transferred.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment, or attend college.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Complete a mental health assessment and follow recommendations. May change residence from grandmother's home with her and Agent's permission. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Payment received through Government Payment Express (charge card agency) - $500 cash bond   12137681
While treated as being paid immediately, actual posting of payment will occur within 5-10 business days.
$500 Bond posted through GPS
Preliminary hearing on June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $4,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND***  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with the co-defendants.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers. The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Deft shall reside with grandmother, Karen Murphy and obey all of her rules. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. 
***DEFENDANT HAS UNTIL 03:00PM ON 05-30-2014 TO PAY CASH BOND***

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
